com.jswiff.swfrecords.actions.Action

Uses of Action in com.jswiff.swfrecords.actions
 

Subclasses of Action in com.jswiff.swfrecords.actions
 class Add
           Computes the sum of two numbers.
 class Add2
           This action is used to implement the addition operator according to the ECMAScript specification, i.e. it performs either string concatenation or numeric addition, depending on the data types of the operands.
 class And
           Performs a boolean AND (&&) operation.
 class AsciiToChar
           Converts an ASCII character code to a character.
 class BitAnd
           Performs a bitwise AND (&).
 class BitLShift
           Performs a bitwise left shift (<<).
 class BitOr
           Performs a bitwise OR (|).
 class BitRShift
           Performs a bitwise right shift (>>).
 class BitURShift
           Performs a bitwise unsigned right shift (>>>).
 class BitXor
           Performs a bitwise XOR (^).
 class Branch
          Base class for branch actions (Jump, If).
 class Call
           Executes the script attached to a specified frame.
 class CallFunction
           Invokes a function, e.g. a user-defined ActionScript function (defined with DefineFunction or DefineFunction2), or a native function, and pushes its result to the stack.
 class CallMethod
           Invokes a method and pushes its result to the stack.
 class CastOp
           This action allows casting from one data type to another.
 class CharToAscii
           Converts a character to its ASCII code.
 class CloneSprite
           Duplicates a sprite, creating a new sprite instance at a given depth.
 class ConstantPool
           Creates a new constant pool.
 class Decrement
           Decrements a number by one.
 class DefineFunction
           This action defines a function.
 class DefineFunction2
          This action is used to declare a function.
 class DefineLocal
           Defines a local variable and sets its value.
 class DefineLocal2
           Defines a local variable without setting its value.
 class Delete
           Deletes an object's property.
 class Delete2
           Destroys an object reference.
 class Divide
           Divides two numbers.
 class EndDrag
           Ends the drag operation in progress, if any.
 class Enumerate
           Iterates over all properties of an object and pushes their names to the stack.
 class Enumerate2
           Iterates over all properties of an object and pushes their names to the stack.
 class Equals
           Tests two numbers for equality.
 class Equals2
           Tests two items for equality.
 class Extends
           Extends creates an inheritance relationship between two classes (instead of classes, interfaces can also be used, since inheritance between interfaces is also possible).
 class GetMember
           Retrieves a member value from an object.
 class GetProperty
           Returns the value of a movie property.
 class GetTime
           Reports the milliseconds since the SWF started playing.
 class GetURL
           Instructs Flash Player to get a specified URL (e.g. an HTML file, an image or another SWF movie) and to display it using a particular target (either a browser frame or a level in Flash Player).
 class GetURL2
          Gets contents from an URL or exchanges data with a server.
 class GetVariable
           Gets a variable's value.
 class GoToFrame
           Instructs Flash Player to go to the specified frame in the current movie.
 class GoToFrame2
           Instructs Flash Player to go to the specified frame.
 class GoToLabel
           Instructs Flash Player to go to a frame associated with the specified label.
 class Greater
           Tests whether a number is greater than another number, taking account of data types (according to ECMA-262 spec).
 class If
           Evaluates a condition to determine the next action in an SWF file.
 class ImplementsOp
           This action specifies the interfaces a class implements.
 class Increment
           Increments a number by one.
 class InitArray
           Creates an array and initializes it with values from the stack.
 class InitObject
           Creates an object and initializes it with values from the stack.
 class InstanceOf
           This action determines if an object is an instance of a specified class (or interface as of SWF 7).
 class Jump
           Creates an unconditional branch.
 class Less
           Tests whether a number is less than another number Performed stack operations:
pop b
pop a
push [a < b] (in SWF 4: 1 if a<b, otherwise 0 - as of SWF 5, true / false)
ActionScript equivalent: < operator
 class Less2
           Tests whether a number is less than another number, taking account of data types (according to ECMA-262 spec).
 class MBAsciiToChar
           Converts an ASCII character code to a multibyte character.
 class MBCharToAscii
           Converts a multibyte character to its ASCII code.
 class MBStringExtract
           Extracts a substring from a string, multibyte-aware.
 class MBStringLength
           Computes the length of a string, multibyte-aware.
 class Modulo
           Calculates the remainder of the division between two numbers.
 class Multiply
           Computes the product of two numbers.
 class NewMethod
           Creates a new object, invoking a constructor.
 class NewObject
           Creates a new object, invoking a constructor.
 class NextFrame
          Instructs Flash Player to advance to the next frame in the current movie.
 class Not
           Performs a boolean NOT (!
 class Or
           Performs a boolean OR (||) operation.
 class Play
           Instructs Flash Player to start playing at the current frame.
 class Pop
          Pops a value from the stack and discards it.
 class PreviousFrame
           Instructs Flash Player to go back to the previous frame in the current movie.
 class Push
           Pushes one or more values to the stack.
 class PushDuplicate
           Duplicates the value on top of the stack.
 class RandomNumber
           Calculates a random non-negative integer less than a specified maximum number.
 class RemoveSprite
          Removes a clone sprite created with CloneSprite.
 class Return
           Causes the execution to immediately return to the calling function.
 class SetMember
           Populates an object's member (either a property or a method) with a given value.
 class SetProperty
           Sets the value of a movie property.
 class SetTarget
           Instructs Flash Player to change the context of subsequent actions, so they apply to an object with the specified name.
 class SetTarget2
           Instructs Flash Player to change the context of subsequent actions, so they apply to an object with the specified name.
 class SetVariable
           Sets a variable.
 class StackSwap
           Swaps the top two items on the stack.
 class StartDrag
           This action makes the target sprite draggable, i.e. it makes sure users can drag it to another location.
 class Stop
           Instructs Flash Player to stop playing at the current frame.
 class StopSounds
           This action mutes all sounds currently playing in the movie.
 class StoreRegister
           Reads the next item from the stack and stores it in the register with the specified number.
 class StrictEquals
           Similar to Equals2, but the two arguments must be of the same type in order to be considered equal (i.e. data types are not converted).
 class StringAdd
           Concatenates two strings.
 class StringEquals
           Tests two strings for equality.
 class StringExtract
           Extracts a substring from a string.
 class StringGreater
           Tests whether a string is greater than another.
 class StringLength
           Computes the length of a string.
 class StringLess
           Tests whether a string is less than another.
 class Subtract
           Computes the difference between two numbers.
 class TargetPath
           This action returns a string containing the target path of a clip in dot notation.
 class Throw
           This action is used to signal an exceptional condition which can be handled by exception handlers declared with Try.
 class ToggleQuality
           Toggles the display between high and low quality.
 class ToInteger
           Converts an item to an integer.
 class ToNumber
           Converts an item into a number.
 class ToString
           Converts an item to a string.
 class Trace
           Sends a debugging output string to the Output panel of the Macromedia Flash authoring environment (in test mode).
 class Try
           This action defines handlers for exceptional conditions (exceptions).
 class TypeOf
           This action returns the type of a specified item as a string.
 class UnknownAction
          This class implements a placeholder for unknown action records.
 class WaitForFrame
           Checks whether the specified frame is loaded.
 class WaitForFrame2
           Checks whether the specified frame is loaded.
 class With
           Defines a with action block which lets you specify an object in order to access it's members without having to repeatedly write the object's name or it's path.

          Removes the action record at the specified position within the block.
